accessDenied.title: Access Denied
accessDenied.message: You do not have permission to access the Settings page. This page is restricted to users with administrative privileges.
accessDenied.action: If you believe you should have access, please contact your administrator or

workspaceDeploymentPath.label: Workspace Deployment Path
workspaceDeploymentPath.help: Path in Databricks workspace where workflow files are deployed for background jobs.

unityCatalog.title: Unity Catalog
unityCatalog.help: Unity Catalog location for storing application data.

auditLog.label: Audit Log Directory
auditLog.help: Directory where audit log files are stored.

endpoint.label: LLM Endpoint
endpoint.help: Databricks serving endpoint name for the LLM.

systemPrompt.label: System Prompt
systemPrompt.help: System prompt that defines the AI assistant behavior.

disclaimer.label: Disclaimer Text
disclaimer.placeholder: This feature uses AI to analyze data assets...
disclaimer.help: Disclaimer shown to users when using AI features.

git.title: Git Settings
git.description: Configure Git repository for YAML storage

jobs.title: Jobs & Workflows Configuration
jobs.description: Configure Databricks job cluster and enable background workflows

jobRuns.dialogDescription: Recent execution history for this workflow
jobRuns.emptyState: No runs found for this workflow

roles.title: Role Based Access Control
roles.description: Define application roles and assign permissions to directory groups.

dialog.description: Define the role name, assigned groups, feature permissions, and approval privileges.

general.assignedGroupsHelp: Users belonging to these groups will inherit this role's permissions.

homeSections.title: Home Sections
homeSections.description: Select which sections appear on the home page for users with this role.

approvalPrivileges.title: Approval Privileges
approvalPrivileges.description: Grant this role the ability to approve specific types of requests.

featurePermissions.title: Feature Permissions
featurePermissions.description: Configure access levels for each feature in the application.

deployment.title: Deployment Policy
deployment.description: Control which Unity Catalog catalogs/schemas users with this role can deploy to. Supports wildcards (* for any) and template variables ({username}, {email}).

allowedCatalogs.label: Allowed Catalogs (comma-separated)
allowedCatalogs.help: Leave empty to prevent deployments. Use * to allow all catalogs.

allowedSchemas.label: Allowed Schemas (comma-separated, optional)
allowedSchemas.help: Leave empty to allow any schema within allowed catalogs.

requestableBy.title: Who can request this role?
requestableBy.description: Select which roles are allowed to request access to this role. Users with these roles will see this role in their requestable roles list.

approvers.title: Who can approve requests for this role?
approvers.description: Select which roles can approve access requests for this role. Users with these roles will receive notifications when someone requests this role.
approvers.hint: If no approvers are selected, requests will be sent to Admin by default.

mcpTokens.title: MCP API Tokens
mcpTokens.description: Manage API tokens for AI assistant integrations via the Model Context Protocol

emptyState.title: No MCP tokens yet
emptyState.description: Create a token to allow AI assistants to access your tools

info.title: Using MCP Tokens
info.description: MCP tokens allow AI assistants to interact with your data governance platform. Each token has specific scopes that control which tools can be accessed.

createDialog.title: Create MCP Token
createDialog.description: Create a new API token for AI assistant integrations. The token will only be shown once.
createDialog.tokenNameHelp: A descriptive name to identify this token
createDialog.scopesHelp: Select the permissions this token should have

createdDialog.title: Token Created Successfully
createdDialog.warning: Copy this token now â€” it won't be shown again!

revokeDialog.title: Revoke Token?
revokeDialog.description: Are you sure you want to revoke the token
revokeDialog.warning: This action cannot be undone. Any AI assistants using this token will immediately lose access.

messages.scopeRequired: At least one scope is required

uiCustomization.title: UI Customization
uiCustomization.description: Customize the application branding, language settings, and appearance.

i18n.title: Language Settings
i18n.enableDescription: When disabled, the application will always use English regardless of browser settings.

logo.title: Custom Logo
logo.help: Enter the URL of your custom logo. Supports SVG, PNG, or JPG formats. Recommended size: 40x40 pixels.
logo.invalidUrl: Please enter a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL

about.title: Custom About Page Content
about.description: Replace the default About page content with custom Markdown. Leave empty to use the default content.
about.placeholder:
# About Our Company

Write your custom about page content here using **Markdown**...
about.noContent: No custom content. The default About page will be shown.

css.title: Custom Stylesheet
css.warningDescription: Invalid or conflicting CSS may break the UI. If the application becomes unusable, clear this field to restore normal functionality. Changes require a page reload.
css.label: Custom CSS
css.help: Enter custom CSS to override the default theme. You can modify CSS variables defined in :root to change colors throughout the app.

messages.saveError: Failed to save UI customization settings
messages.reloadRequired: Reload the page to see some changes.
